controller

Class CreateUserController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.CreateUserController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javafx.fxml.Initializable

    public class CreateUserController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable, java.io.Serializable
    Creates a new user with the entered credentials. Checks if the info entered already exists or not to avoid conflict.
    Author:
    Rizwan Khan(mrk150) && Ahmed Ghoneim(asg179)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createUser

        public void createUser(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new user if they do not exist. Will create a specialized folder for each user to preserve their data in the project working directory.
        Parameters:
        event - Pushing confirm button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • cancelUser

                throws java.io.IOException

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • createNewUser

        public int createNewUser(java.lang.String user,
                         java.lang.String password)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Adds info entered into list of users if they do not exist.
        Parameters:
        user - The username entered
        password - The password entered
        Returns:
        Integer for error checking
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checkUser

        public int checkUser()
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Called in createNewUser() to check if the credentials entered match any other user or not
        Returns:
        Integer for error checking
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • saveUserList

        public void saveUserList(java.lang.String user,
                         java.lang.String password)
        Serializes the list of users, adding the newly added info to the list of users to serialize. Overrides file "userArrayList.ser" if it exists
        Parameters:
        user -
        password -

      • loadUsers

        public void loadUsers()
        Loads current list of usersl, if they exist. If "userArrayList.ser" file exists, will deserialize that and store as current list of users.
